column5: Heading out of Ashbridge's today at 4:00 PM with my brother for some more chinook action. I have no idea how rain will affect the bite with these fish. Anybody?
Wind will have more affect on the fish then the rain will.   Only thing it will affect is you getting wet
Rain will only affect them when they are in the rivers when they go brown
Rain no problem .. Clap of thunder shuts them down and time for you to go home .
The fish do not mind getting wet!  Go get em!
As it turns out, we were into salmon the whole time! Rain dance!
We landed 20 in total last night. I've never experienced a triple hook up before. So exhilarating! We caught a bunch of little ones as well and they are really quite beautiful.
Wow, that's a great way to spend an evening!
Triple headers of screaming kings are the best kind of chaos
Thats some major kings dude.  I hope we get into them like that this saturday.  As for yer  cap.
1044228_10152943554190411_1896857363_n.jpg  Your friend in the ball cap, holding the smaller fish...an atlantic or pink??
Neither, small chinook would be my guess.
